title: Taliban Threat, Disillusionment Tamp Down Afghan Vote
text:
KABUL—Slightly more than two million Afghans voted in presidential elections over the weekend, a historic low for a nation beleaguered by a nearly 18-year war and disillusioned by the government’s failure to deliver on its pledge to end corruption and spur overhauls.

As vote counting got under way on Sunday, a day after the vote, with, an official from the national election commission put the voter turnout at about 2.2 million—just 23% of those Afghans registered to vote and 7% of the country’s estimated 32.2 million people....
description: Slightly more than two million Afghans voted in presidential elections over the weekend, a historic low for a nation beleaguered by a nearly 18-year war and the government’s failure to deliver on its pledge to end corruption and spur overhauls
